00031 #include <stdio.h>
00032 #include <stdarg.h>
00033 #include <syslog.h>
00034 #include <string.h>
00035 #include <fcntl.h>
00036 #include <ctype.h>
00037 #include "err_util.h"
00038 
00039 static int verbosity = 0;
00040 static int fg = 0;
00041 
00042 static char message_buf[500];
00043 
00044 void initerr(char *progname, int set_verbosity, int set_fg)
00045 {
00046         verbosity = set_verbosity;
00047         fg = set_fg;
00048         if (!fg)
00049                 openlog(progname, LOG_PID, LOG_DAEMON);
00050 }
00051 
00052 
00053 void printerr(int priority, char *format, ...)
00054 {
00055         va_list args;
00056         int ret;
00057         int buf_used, buf_available;
00058         char *buf;
00059 
00060         /* Don't bother formatting a message we're never going to print! */
00061         if (priority > verbosity)
00062                 return;
00063 
00064         buf_used = strlen(message_buf);
00065         /* subtract 4 to leave room for "...\n" if necessary */
00066         buf_available = sizeof(message_buf) - buf_used - 4;
00067         buf = message_buf + buf_used;
00068 
00069         /*
00070          * Aggregate lines: only print buffer when we get to the
00071          * end of a line or run out of space
00072          */
00073         va_start(args, format);
00074         ret = vsnprintf(buf, buf_available, format, args);
00075         va_end(args);
00076 
00077         if (ret < 0)
00078                 goto printit;
00079         if (ret >= buf_available) {
00080                 /* Indicate we're truncating */
00081                 strcat(message_buf, "...\n");
00082                 goto printit;
00083         }
00084         buf_used = strlen(message_buf);
00085         if (buf_used > 0 && message_buf[buf_used - 1] == '\n')
00086                 goto printit;
00087         return;
00088 printit:
00089         if (fg) {
00090                 fprintf(stderr, "%s", message_buf);
00091         } else {
00092                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "%s", message_buf);
00093         }
00094         /* reset the buffer */
00095         memset(message_buf, 0, sizeof(message_buf));
00096 }
00097 
00098 void print_hexl(int pri, unsigned char *cp, int length)
00099 {
00100         int i, j, jm;
00101         unsigned char c;
00102 
00103         printerr(pri, "length %d\n",length);
00104         printerr(pri, "\n");
00105 
00106         for (i = 0; i < length; i += 0x10) {
00107                 printerr(pri, "  %04x: ", (unsigned int)i);
00108                 jm = length - i;
00109                 jm = jm > 16 ? 16 : jm;
00110 
00111                 for (j = 0; j < jm; j++) {
00112                         if ((j % 2) == 1)
00113                                 printerr(pri, "%02x ", (unsigned int)cp[i+j]);
00114                         else
00115                                 printerr(pri, "%02x", (unsigned int)cp[i+j]);
00116                 }
00117                 for (; j < 16; j++) {
00118                         if ((j % 2) == 1)
00119                                 printerr(pri,"   ");
00120                         else
00121                                 printerr(pri,"  ");
00122                 }
00123                 printerr(pri," ");
00124 
00125                 for (j = 0; j < jm; j++) {
00126                         c = cp[i+j];
00127                         c = isprint(c) ? c : '.';
00128                         printerr(pri,"%c", c);
00129                 }
00130                 printerr(pri,"\n");
00131         }
00132 }
